website_summaries.verdict: Perfect slow cook technology meets portability in a unit designed for spill-free, easy transport of food. All at a comfortable price point.
pros: Handles flip out for easy carrying
After cooking completely, the warm setting keeps food hot
Lid can be removed and is dishwasher-safe, as is the ceramic crock
cons: Be careful when opening lid, as escaping steam can cause burns
No light to indicate if unit is on

customer_reviews.title: Glass shattered into my meal
customer_reviews.text: I have this crock for a year and a half of gentle use - about every other month. As I was making a soup today, I heard a loud pop and turned around to find that the glass lid had shattered. There was nothing cold on the outside or any reason that (even an untampered) glass should have broken. Now my meal is ruined, I've lost several hours of time, and I need a new crock pot. Needless to say, I won't be getting it from Hamilton Beach.
customer_reviews.author: Damon CPA

customer_reviews.title: KABOOM
customer_reviews.text: KABOOM! The other reviewers are correct. It explodes. Since I knew the reviews, I only latch it in transport. This morning, I put room temperature pizza sauce and meat balls that had been defrosted for about 5 minutes into the crockpot. I did not have it on. I turned around and it absolutely exploded. All the pieces of the lid were pebble sized. The contents and the crockpot were knocked to the floor with the blast.
customer_reviews.author: Dulce

customer_reviews.title: Glass lid exploded with normal use.
customer_reviews.text: Two hours into making chicken stock I hear a loud craaaaaack in the other room. Yep, the lid shattered. I'm not stupid, I learned my lesson about thermal expansion the hard way many years ago. This was purely a defect since the thing had been sitting undisturbed on the kitchen counter. Hamilton Beach does not honor the glass under their 1 year warranty either.
customer_reviews.author: Azag Arcturus

customer_reviews.title: Lid Hinge Defective and Replaced Broken...
customer_reviews.text: Found out on my first attempt at cooking with this is that the hinge for the lid was crooked. It was bent too far forward thus making it impossible to both latches properly and wasn't able to set the lid evenly on the crockpot. I had to take the hinge itself off to be able to set the lid on the crockpot. I give it two stars because it did a great job cooking, but due to the hinge won't be able to use it to transport food safely. Update: Got a replacement from Amazon and when it arrived the crockpot itself was in pieces. This time getting a refund. Pictured added.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Cooking is fast but still leaves meat very tender!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for everything. Pork Chops, Ribs, Roast and chicken.. Everything has been perfect. never has the bottom burned. Love the lid pick up and place in refrig.. Heat it up the next day on low for an hour or two and it is just like you just made it. My kids hate leftovers so I trick them.. I would Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L Ware

customer_reviews.title: Love This Crock Pot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this particular slow cooker after doing some research on 6-qt. units. I have two 3 1/2-qt. slow cookers and I wanted a larger one so I could make larger quantities. This particular unit was very much in my price range and I decided to go for it. So far I have been very happy with it.I use this for everything. Pork Chops, Ribs, Roast and chicken.. Everything has been perfect. never has the bottom burned. Love the lid pick up and place in refrig.. Heat it up the next day on low for an hour or two and it is just like you just made it
customer_reviews.author: sadrack stlouis

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach is NO Good!
customer_reviews.text: The second time I used this slow cooker, the glass lid exploded, out of the blue, for no apparent reason. I notified Hamilton Beach and they said that glass parts are not covered under their warranty. I would definitely NOT recommend this slow cooker. I got one meal out of my purchase, and that's it! Not only am I out the price of the slow cooker, but also the $15 of chicken that had to be thrown out. And worst of all, the company doesn't stand by its products. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: The Truth

customer_reviews.title: No issues with this slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: No issues so far. Instructions indicate you can lock the latch when cooking, which is what we do. Actually, if you don't lock it down the lid doesn't sit evenly on the pot. I love how the lid simply swings up and out of the way. No more looking for a place to set the lid down when scooping out the food. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Ohana of 3Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: More Convenient, Harder to Clean
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Convenient, portable, solid construction (My attempts to disassemble it haven't broken it yet.) Cons: Difficult to clean basin. If you detach the arm that holds the lid in order to clean it, the bracket inside that holds it is not attached to anything else and will fall inside the basin. The unit cannot be disassembled, and the manufacturer will not help you. Other: When you lift the lid all the way up, condensation on the lid pours down onto whatever surface the cooker is on. This can be either a pro or con, depending on whether you want the water to go back into the pot or spill water and food residue all over your counter.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Williams

customer_reviews.title: It was beautifully and sturdily packaged
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when this came the day after I ordered it. It was beautifully and sturdily packaged, too. The first and only time I have cooked in it, I used a liner and made chili. It worked great! The problem is that I cannot get a funny smell out of the lid. In fact, it smells awful. I have washed it with soda and water and it still smells really bad. Other than that, it works very well and I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: jamfromOK

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love my crockpot. I searched around a lot for one that had the lid stabilization and easy travel and go type style. I also think one of the best features is the hinge lid, because who wants to find a place to put the lid down constantly? It is lacking a way to wrap up the cord when traveling, and the heating options of 'warm, low, high' are pretty basic - but for the price it is great. I love the stainless steel look, cooks well, and travels well. Can't complain
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One serious design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Love the features on this crock pot. There us one serious design fault and that is the latch in front of the pot. When you are done cooking and need to open it you will need a silicone oven glove to safely open. The clamp is on the front if the pot and requires you to flip it upward over the steaming hot food you have just made. I would have preferred on hinge on the lid and the ability to lift the lid off the pot instead. It cooks to perfection!
customer_reviews.author: B. Schuck

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: The cheapest quality slow cooker ever! My ceramic bowl insert, cracked in half during the first wash. I haven't even tried using it yet and it broke in half!
customer_reviews.author: rosycheeks

customer_reviews.title: Works Well & The Locking Lid Is Great!
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for one of my partners, who only had a small 3-quart Slow Cooker and wanted a bigger one for when she came down to stay with me on the weekends. The locking lid is easily the biggest selling point of this slow cooker; she travels 1.5 hours on Friday night and is able to bring down a roast, put it on warm for a bit, and make dinner for me. All in all, this gift ended up working out well for her as well as for me -- I don't get paid back for most birthday gifts in Bourbon Pork Roasts, but I could get used to this.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGeekyGirlTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: The locking lid should make it quite easy to transport meals
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once, but so far this slow cooker does exactly what it is supposed to do. Despite what other reviewers have said, the lid does, in fact, lock down and seal quite tightly (there are two small vent holes to prevent it from over-pressurizing.. The locking lid should make it quite easy to transport meals.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H

customer_reviews.title: Knob Labels Rub Off
customer_reviews.text: This is a great slow cooker, especially for the price. I loved the rubber-like seal, the pop-up handles, and the electric simplicity. There are no LEDs or keyboards to break down. It is also easy to clean. I docked it one point on the durability scale because of the lettering (Off, Warm, Low, High) on the control knob rubbed off after two years of use. I got a new knob from the Internet for $14.64 including shipping.
customer_reviews.author: James P Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Roast Ruined
customer_reviews.text: As others had said in their reviews, a couple hours into my roast in the slow cooker, I heard a loud popping noise. Sure enough, the lid had shattered-shards of glass in the meat and all over my counter. I'm not sure if I should just buy a new slow cooker or try to ask for a better replacement lid of some kind? A true bummer because now I'm out the cost of my meal that was ruined and the price I paid for this stupid thing I only used about 5 times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I love this slow cooker! I had put off buying one because I had a bad experience with another brand. After reading the reviews on Amazon, I decided to try this model. I am very happy with it. I love that there is a seal around the lid! I also love that the handles are foldable. Someone actually put thought into this design! The only thing I have noticed is that I think the high setting is very hot, you might be able to cut at least an hour off the cooking time because of how high it is. I have not tried this yet, but I think I will.
customer_reviews.author: J L W

customer_reviews.title: Great Solid Minimalistic Slow Cooker!
customer_reviews.text: It makes great slow cooker food! So far made chili and beef stew on it and it does the job. I like the simple three settings, High, Low, and Warm. The latch is also great to ensure tight lid closing. The warning sign for hot steam is great as I almost burned myself on that. Well built and great to carry it for parties with the handles on the side. But be careful as all the surface of the slow cooker gets hot. I would not recommend if you have small children at home. This is perfect for people looking for a simple slow cooker. As I heard more complicated system you have, its more likely to break.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: NOT as good as previous design.
customer_reviews.text: I have the previous model of this design and this one. Previous design was exceptional and sealed very well, I purchased this last year and have used about 3-4 times only because the lid does not seal well. I took it tonight to a holiday party and had hot cocoa in it... guess what sloshed all over the back of my mini van? I also miss the spoon rest that was on the previous model and the handles were better for carrying. This only gets 2 stars where as the Hamilton Beach Stay or Go model before was 5 stars. Very disappointed they changed the design and I can no longer find the model I like.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lynn

customer_reviews.title: A Crock pot with an attached lid???!!!! Get out of here!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome crock pot. I love that the lid is attached so you just lift it up to serve!!! It's so annoying having to hold a lid with one hand that is dripping with condensation while trying to spoon food out with the other hand and put on a plate that you now have had to set down somewhere in order to manage all of this. I use crock pots at parties all the time so having found this I am stoked!!!! Why didn't they come up with this a long time ago??!!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE this and will never buy another style of crock pot again!
customer_reviews.author: Loves2ShoponAmazon

customer_reviews.title: GREW MOLD!
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with this product. I was on the hunt for a great crockpot and I thought I landed it with this! Initially it was great and earned my trust of leaving the house with this on. Moving past the winter months, I’ve used it sporadically. When I took it out of my kitchen cabinet to use today I was shocked to find mold growing inside of it and on the edges of the inside pot!!! In the garbage it goes... Buyer BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Glass lid shattered on opening!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 3.5 years ago and use once a month at most. I was using for dinner the other night. I unlocked and opened the lid to add the last ingredient and the lid completely shattered - see pictures. Slow cooker gone and dinner thrown out! I asked Hamilton Beach customer service for a replacement twice and they have refused saying that they don't cover glass - "glass is fragile and can break when it is subject to any type of damage or abuse". Apparently opening the lid is considered "abuse"??? Obviously Hamilton Beach is not interested in satisfied/loyal customers. Thanks for letting me know I can purchase a new lid!! No thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dukovic

customer_reviews.title: Cooked all day with lid latched and didn't break
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make pulled pork for the Superbowl, I cooked in it all day on high with the lid locked closed and the glass didn't break. It says in the instructions that you can have it latched while cooking. If you don't latch it while cooking the lid won't sit flat because of the seal. The crock seems very well made and the heating part of the unit is very lightweight so it is easy to transport. The handles on the sides pop up and are solid. For the money I can't imagine a unit being any better, I will update if the glass lid shatters.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: average
customer_reviews.text: It is a cheaper slow cooker so I guess I cannot expect the best quality. It just felt light weight. The insert broke with in 5 months of use. My husband put it in the base after washing and when I went to put chicken and some water for cooking and it promptly poured out the bottom. So I am thinking that the insert was not very thick .
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous design. Does have warning on lid.
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of this. The problem is that it is extremely hot to open the lid this way. There are warning signs on the lid. Could be quite dangerous if not paying attention. Living a lid straight up dissipates the heat better than this way with a hinge. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: works good but...
customer_reviews.text: the lid on this is a little annoying, other then that its great. works good and cleans easily enough.
customer_reviews.author: Zepherea

customer_reviews.title: Rarely used, now toast
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this slow cooker back in 2014, but have only used it 5 times. Today was #5. I was making bone broth, turned the slow cooker on high and a few minutes later I smelled an electrical smell. I shut the cooker off and checked the contents. Lukewarm. Contents ruined. Rarely used slow cooker should have lasted a lot longer. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a Christmas gift for my daughter, she wanted one with the locking lid to take to work on occasions. Since it’s a gift, I don’t have personal knowledge about it but since it’s a crockpot I’m sure she’ll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Watson

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this slow cooker, it is simple and modern. I prefer one that isn't digital and has the old-fashioned knob. We have had great success with this product and have used it for making bone broths, ribs, soups and stews. I am a huge fan of the locking lid and the handles on the side. Haven't traveled with it yet but looks like it would transport easily with the locking mechanism. The heat appears to be consistent, no problems with burning on the bottom and the high setting really cooks food quickly. I would definitely purchase this product again and at this price it is a really good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah B.

customer_reviews.title: Handle holds water
customer_reviews.text: When the slow cooker arrived I washed the lid and insert completely. I could not get the water out from under the handle and there is no way to remove it to be able to dry it. I returned it without even using it. This is a major design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Gilli

customer_reviews.title: Nice kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: I love the size, and the shape works well for ribs, whole chicken, and longer roasts. I would give it 5 stars except that the seal isn't very good, even when clamped down. I used it to make and move a batch of stew and wound up with some of the juice on the floor of the car, even without having to do any evasive driving or hitting any rough road. If you're going to transport it full I highly recommend wrapping a large towel around it. Other than that it's fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Wine Seller

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this slow cooker. The locking lid is honestly my favorite part haha. I feel it definitely helps cook our meals better than a regular lid. Works great, love the size, and would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a new kitchen appliance!!
customer_reviews.author: jam ab

customer_reviews.title: but it doesn't seem sturdy especially the cover
customer_reviews.text: This slow cooker seems to work well (I have only used it three times so far), but it doesn't seem sturdy especially the cover. And I find you can't use the crock for storage in the fridge because the cover only fits when it is inside the metal cooker part. Although the price was inexpensive and I know you get what you pay for, If I were going to buy another I wouldn't pick this one.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A. Kiley

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Got this yesterday and have not let it cool down from round the clock use for lots of chicken. The cook time seems to be faster than most recipes say; so, I cut four hours down tho three for the next whole 4 pound chicken. It makes cooking chicken stock very easy with the carcasses. It is now loaded with five pounds of split chicken breasts. Guess I'll have to go to the store and find some more things to cook I freeze a lot).
customer_reviews.author: Old Man of the Lake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Slow Cooker
customer_reviews.text: This slow cooker is an excellent size for stews, roasts, homemade chicken and noodles, even hot wassail! Love how the lid completely seals to prevent leaks when transporting. Also, the lid conveniently removes for ease in serving and cleaning. The side handles can flip down for space saving storage. I also love that it has high, low, and warm settings keeping it simple. I didn't want a complicated dial gadget with too many programming options. The inside completely removes for easy cleaning. The black with stainless steel looks sharp! No regrets, would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: AdoptShelterPets

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: Haven't exactly tried to carry it around with it full to test what it advertises. But I love this. HB makes great products anyways but this with the lid hinge. Amazing. Just make sure when store it detach the lid and have it rest on top so the rubber seal doesn't have constant pressure on it to potentially mess that up
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My crockpot shattered today. It was cooking and I heard a loud pop, went to look and the lid had shattered all in my food! Very upset and as my warranty is out. Loved this crock pot very very disappointed. And I cannot find a replacement lid anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Taryn Trowbridge

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great and cleans up easy
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great and cleans up easy. The lock down lid is nice, and I don't agree that the steam release when opening is that bad, if you are just a little careful you don't even need gloves in my opinion. I do wish that it had a timer feature, but hey, I got it for like 23 dollars, and for the performance and size I am extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Growing Up
customer_reviews.text: This was a bit bigger than I expected (not sure why I say this as it does tell the size). I can make a lot of things in this. I wish I had gotten a smaller size and it is mostly just me who eats so its a lot of food for one person. This product makes the meat so tender and juicy. The meat falls right off the bone. Its good when we have a small dinner party. Can feed everyone a good size portion. Always have leftovers though. Still good the next couple of days!
customer_reviews.author: T. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great for Parties.
customer_reviews.text: With the handle that flips up to stay on the cooker, the counter remains clean and no one breaks the lid. Easily comes apart to clean. Wish I had this one before buying a different one 2 years ago. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Egret

customer_reviews.title: It works great and I have had no issues with it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 6 months ago and use it quite often. It works great and I have had no issues with it. Other reviews mentioned issues with the glass on the lid cracking during cooking--just wanted to throw my 2 cents in that I cook it with the lid latched and have had no problems so far. This is a great basic slow cooker at a great price, and I have been very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NWSurlyGirly

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Love this slow cooker, only thing I don't like is how loose the lid is on the hinge, I worry when I open it the lid will fall off. Other than that I have not had any problems at all, very easy to clean and the pot itself does not scratch easily
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: The lid easily comes off or simply stands up so you don't have to set it somewhere while you dish your food. Easy to clean. Good size for serving a family. The handles flip up to make ut easy to carry but flip down to fit on the counter better. I love this thing. the crock is also very easy to clean. Releases baked on food pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think you can mess up a slow cooker, but this one is awesome. Pretty self explanatory, I love the locking lid and handles to make it easy to transport.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: The hinge is cheaply made. You can't set the ...
customer_reviews.text: The hinge is cheaply made. You can't set the top on without it being hinged. When it's hinged it doesn't seat correctly unless you latch the top down. In the troubleshooting area, it says to not cook with the top hinges to prevent the seal from being ruined. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Capella28

customer_reviews.title: Why no light?
customer_reviews.text: I like the feature of not having to lay the lid down when serving food from pot. But, here is another stupid slow cooker that doesn't have a light on it so you know it is still on. Why they manufacture doesn't put lights on all of them, I have no ideal. I think this is stupid. I had one that the breaker turned off and I didn't know it and the food wasn't done when i went to serve it. If he had a light then i would have seen it off and would have known something was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Art w.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Crock Pot
customer_reviews.text: Nice Crock pot. The hinged lid is great at parties. You can open it up and serve yourself with one hand. You don't have to look for someplace to set the top down while you are serving. The sealed lid is another big plus! You can prepare a dish and transport it in your car without fear of it spilling. Genius device!
customer_reviews.author: Herb

customer_reviews.title: Not slow at all
customer_reviews.text: Lots of things to be happy about, but one major flaw overrides everything. It cooks way too fast! Maybe we've just got a turkey, but everything cooks in half the time. Sort of defeats the purpose of a slow cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: The meat literally fell off the bone and clean-up was easy because of the cooking bag I purchased through Amazon ...
customer_reviews.text: This new item was used last weekend to cook an 8lb turkey breast. The meat literally fell off the bone and clean-up was easy because of the cooking bag I purchased through Amazon also. The crock liner was a bit heavy to carry with the cooked contents, so I must downsize my next experiment for safety reasons. I have a recipe book for other slow-cooker meals I hope to try soon. But first use was not fun when I had to remove the heavier crock-part of munchies.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: It actually cooks slowly!
customer_reviews.text: Finally! I have gone through 3 slow cookers, trying to find one that cooks at a reasonable temperature. This seems to do the trick. I love the collapsible handles and the fact that the lid locks into places keeps all that steam and moisture from escaping, which helps keep my meals from drying out. The price was great and the simple dial function is all I need, especially with the "warm" setting. I did a lot of research before purchasing this slow cooker. If you're looking for a slow cooker that actually cooks slowly and you don't want to spend a fortune, the Hamilton Beach is a good bet.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.  Extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to transport hot sausage gravy to a potluck. It was perfect. The rubber gasket seal does it's job very well. Made the hot gravy at home, left it on warm with the lid locked, plugged it in on warm once it reached it's destination. Didn't dry out or scorch. Definitely worth the money. NOTE: Don't leave the lid locked when you are cooking....only when you are transporting the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Like most slow cookers, 95% of the heat likely escapes out the sides. But this one works as well as can be expected for this type. The swivel top is very convenient although the joint is very fragile and I've broken that already.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice cooker - very short cord
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice cooker. I like the idea of the clamp to hold the lid in place, but it has a ridiculously short cord. I measured it and it is only 2 1/2 feet long. Where I want to put the cooker on my counter top I can't, because it won't reach the electrical outlet. Poor thought went into this.
customer_reviews.author: Dogula

customer_reviews.title: I love this crockpot
customer_reviews.text: This crockpot is great if you use it on the go often. I always find myself making dips and different things for the holidays and never have to worry about the lid falling off. The settings are very basic but it works for me. I honestly don't think any crockpot this size is easy to clean but the stainless outside does wipe down nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shattered on use after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Used fine for two years and then on thanksgiving (today) had corn in there and a loud pop and the lid shattered all in my creamed corn. Won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.F

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this format of slow cooker. The handle is ingenious and makes serving and transport much easier than standard cookers. You have to be careful not to burn yourself when opening the cooker though since the handle opens in such a way that all the steam escapes right into where your hand is. The handle also seems more robust than traditional cookers, and it will balance on top of the cooker without needing space on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Short cord and hot hands
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the company I purchased from. My dislikes for this crock pot are: 1. The cord is extremely short. I almost need an extension cord to use it on my kitchen counter, and do use one to put it in the exact place I want it. 2. The steam almost burns your hand when you open the lid (remembering most crock pots have handles on the top for opening, this one is on the front). Other then that it cooks even and the lid seals tight for transport.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, easy to use and great price!
customer_reviews.text: We love this crockpot. The fact that we can seal the lid tight is a great feature when you are cooking, but also when you are traveling so your food doesn't spill in your car! I would highly recommend this crock-pot. Also we have a very expensive crock-pot at home, and I think this one cooks our food better. We have yet to burn anything in this crock pot! WIN!
customer_reviews.author: Schafers

customer_reviews.title: Very nice crockpot. I love the added lid holder
customer_reviews.text: Very nice crockpot. I love the added lid holder, just one of those little things that you didn't think you needed but it so handy to have, no more messy pools of water on the countertops from the lid! You can also seal it up for traveling which I haven't done yet but am excited that I can now!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but difficult to remove smells
customer_reviews.text: I've cooked two soups in it so far. I love the temperature variation in this compared to my old crock pot. The Low setting is a true low. My only gripe is that I can't get the smell of the soup I cooked out of the rubber seal on the lid. I tried washing it multiple times. But the smell appears to be permanent.
customer_reviews.author: J. MILES

customer_reviews.title: Love this slow cooker!
customer_reviews.text: I love how the lid locks and I can take it with me to a party. I've had it for years and it still works great. It is large so you can make a lot of food if you need to. Definitely worth the price. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Sossin

customer_reviews.title: This slow cooker works great. Prepare and walk away - no need to ...
customer_reviews.text: This slow cooker works great. Prepare and walk away - no need to even check on it if the recipe says just let it cook. I love it. The top has a ring of rubber around the top and it really makes the lid secure to the point you don't need to worry about spillage when traveling. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Greyhound Gal

customer_reviews.title: Love!!! Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Received this for Christmas. Have used it so many times since. Love the lock and spill proof; also love the handles at both ends! Makes it so that I don't have to use an oven mit to car crock pot.
customer_reviews.author: Abe T

customer_reviews.title: Love how much you can cook at once and it's ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Have we really been living without one of these?? Love how much you can cook at once and it's pretty much fool proof. So far we've made shredded chicken and fajita vegetables for tacos & an amazing chili with everything imaginable in it. Cooking made easy!!
customer_reviews.author: Althea Photography

customer_reviews.title: Top not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Nice pot but when not unlocked lid stays open a crack.
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I purchased. My first was for me. My niece borrowed it so often I bought one for her. It works well, seals well for travel and I love the lid being attached. The only thing I would like that it does not have is a programmable mode. But I usually set it and let it slow cook all day for tasty meals with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: aire2aire

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: This product is great, the only thing I dont like is having to open the lid at the front where all the steam comes out. I'd rather not have to grab an oven mitt every time I lift the lid. Other than that, it's a good product, great value for the price
customer_reviews.author: lauralee1964

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good crock, and that's no crock. I read that some crock pots leach lead from the ceramic so I paid $9 for a lead test swab and I'm glad I did, came up clean. This is the first one I've had with a hinged lid, good move. All in all I got nothing bad to say about this cooker.
customer_reviews.author: g

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this crockpot! The fact that the lid locks down is great for taking it on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Chekas125

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this crock pot once (I own a couple), but it works great. I'm a huge fan of cooking in the crock pots. I like the ability to cook during the night or day - home or not because it allows me to save time. One of my favorite ways to cook applesauce and beans!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love that the lid flips up and you don't have to lay it down.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Diehm

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a simple slow cooker. Every dish we have made came out great. Seems to cook evenly and at proper temperatures. We like the lid that opens to the back and that you don't have to find a place to lay the lid when it is opened. We would recommend this cooker to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tamie

customer_reviews.title: It cooks things slowly.
customer_reviews.text: My fiance and I bought this when we started working actual full time jobs and wanted to eat right when we arrived home. We went with this one, even though it doesn't have a timer or auto-shut off, but it works very well! We have cooked on low and high, and everything turns out wonderfully. The collapsible handles on the edge makes it much easier to store, and the lid stays open without you having to set it somewhere else when serving. Very good, and very worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: My favorite part is being able to clip the cover to ...
customer_reviews.text: My favorite part is being able to clip the cover to the handle instead of setting it down on the counter when it is open and in use. Also great to be able to lock it closed in transport to prevent accidents. Perfect size for our family of 4-6 (depending on the night).
customer_reviews.author: Genell S. Baun

customer_reviews.title: Works well but large and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Very good sturdy effective product. but VERY heavy and large, difficult to store if you aren't using it.
customer_reviews.author: Maya Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Potlucks here I come!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I could lay out 4 large chicken breasts side by side without overlap. Great for families & potlucks, with a locking lid & handles that fold down at the sides. Lid removes easily for cleaning, can cook with the lid locked.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kobish

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal! I bought this as a gift for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Deal! I bought this as a gift for my daughter and she loves it. She uses it several times a week and has no complaints. She loves the stay lock handle and the fact that it only has "warm, low, or high" settings. Not complicated at all! Easy to use, easy to clean. This is a wonderful crock pot for the money!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon McNeely

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I use this for all my slow cooking recipes. It does the job for large or small recipes
customer_reviews.author: Homer Adams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Used only once so far and very pleased with the workings of Slow Cooker. Like the fact that top can be firmly attached so as not to spill when taking it to a function.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Lehman

customer_reviews.title: I love the locking lid
customer_reviews.text: I love the locking lid. The heating quality of the crock pot is just where I expect it to be. The low cooks according to recipes as well as the high. The locking lid really does prevent spills. Took the crockpot full of taco meat to a family get together and it tipped over in the car and not a drop of the grease came out.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Colvin

customer_reviews.title: We like it, is a good option for busy lives.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't seem to seal properly, but is not a pressure one. it does the job and so far food tastes good. My wife has been using it for almost every recipe she thinks it looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime S. Flores

customer_reviews.title: It works just like it says
customer_reviews.text: Can't complain about this. It works just like it says.
customer_reviews.author: Matt McFarland

customer_reviews.title: I still have it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it about 5 years ago or more and it still works!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had more
customer_reviews.text: I use it for making bone broth wow how convenient
customer_reviews.author: Ciera56

customer_reviews.title: Nice appliance
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made appliance. We're happy with the hinged removable cover and side handles, but are surprised that there is no glow light indicating the pot is heating or at temperature. For that omission, we deduct a star.
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: I am sad and frustrated
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this slow cooker. I was looking forward to making food and being able to take it places. I am sad and frustrated, the lid won't close and it won't lock closed Sending it back, what a waste of $$
customer_reviews.author: CynthiaB

customer_reviews.title: Lid exploded
customer_reviews.text: Lid exploded into tiny pieces of glass and glass dust
customer_reviews.author: R A. F. Poirier

customer_reviews.title: Not well thought out
customer_reviews.text: One would think a simple device as such would be without fault. However this style crockpot has a bad flaw - when it is not and you open it ALL the stream goes straight up the lid to your hands and burns you. Worst design. I hate this thing and am stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: us

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise I just absolutely love it because you can cock the lid back when ...
customer_reviews.text: Works real well but the lid does not seal or sit properly unless it is snapped down and then it gets a lot of condensation on the inside of the lid when cooking. Otherwise I just absolutely love it because you can cock the lid back when you are serving food.
customer_reviews.author: Merry M Boyd

customer_reviews.title: This is a great cooker! It does a pork roast for pulled ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cooker! It does a pork roast for pulled pork in a few hours then will keep in warm until ready to pull. I like this pot very much, and you can carry cooked food in it to pot lucks.
customer_reviews.author: Dancing Bones

customer_reviews.title: Would like a longer cable
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I'm very happy with it! Only thing is that I wish the cord was a bit longer. It can be hard to get to the plug ins under the cabinet and /or opening the lid while under the cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's such a great investment! Best money spent on Amazon and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm obsessed with my crockpot! It works so well and I make crockpot meals 3-4 times a week with this one. It's such a great investment! Best money spent on Amazon and I rave to all my friends and family about this machine! Order and you will not be disappointed! 6 stars all the way!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nakagawa Family

customer_reviews.title: I was very happy to see the simplicity of the Hamilton Beach Stay ...
customer_reviews.text: My previous crockpot was had an electronic panel and no way of keeping the lid from sliding off when I had to travel with it. I was very happy to see the simplicity of the Hamilton Beach Stay or Go with a simple turn dial and a nice front clasp to keep the lid secure when I go somewhere with it. Easy to remove the lid for cleaning and easy to put back on. Extremely happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Stoutd

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this item! The lid is does not have to be taken off to open which saves space and mess. The handles make it easy to travel with or just to maneuver around your kitchen. Over all I'm very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Holthaus

customer_reviews.title: Every kitchen must have!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the latches for taking it with us. Solid construction and holds temperature very well.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Bolano

customer_reviews.title: I can't stop making ribs with this thing.....
customer_reviews.text: Since I bought this thing I've gained so much damn weight that I had to buy another product to keep the weight off. I love the way it looks and that it locks. There is a rubber gasket so no leaks when you're transporting it to church or the park.
customer_reviews.author: Christna Fredrick Kim

customer_reviews.title: No more spills when transporting.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase it to take to work for the monthly pot-luck and it is fantastic. No more worrying about spills when transporting it. I love the design, that the handles flip down, and the lid can be latched on. It all comes apart to clean very easily too!
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Tilton

customer_reviews.title: great for making her desserts and her cider
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it, great for making her desserts and her cider.
customer_reviews.author: robertparten

customer_reviews.title: Recommend highly! Nice price
customer_reviews.text: Cooked in twice with leaver locked and love this cooker! Recommend highly!!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Miller

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Stay or Go Portable 6 Quart Slow Cooker With Lid Lock for Easy Transport, Dishwasher-Safe Crock, Stainless Steel (33461)
product_meta.description: Color:Stainless SteelFrom soup day Saturdays to an occasional party pot roast, the Hamilton Beach stay or go 6 quart lid latch strap slow cooker has you covered. Fabulous for home use but flexible enough to take on the Road, This slow cooker is designed to meet your needs.
feature_bullets: Single clip seals lid onto base to reduce messy spills
Bring 6 quarts of hot food to potlucks or parties anytime
Hinged lid stays up then easily detaches for dishwasher cleanup
Folding handles snap up for carrying and fold down for storage
High, low and keep warm settings

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,359 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
